page.title: 06Spinning and Weaving,Exford
page.content: Many people in this area use the sheeps fleece for making wool either for knitting or weaving. A lady called Mrs Hutchings came to school to teach us about dying, spinning and weaving the wool. She used all sorts of flowers, leaves and herbs to get the different colours for the dyes. They made some lovely shades of green,pink and yellow. After the wool has been dyed,the next stage is spinning. This is best done with a spinning wheel. It is quite difficult to learn how to use the treadle. When the wool has been spun, it can been wound into skeins or balls and then it is ready for weaving or knitting.
